### Prerequisites

AdGuard Content Blocker

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

other (specify in comment below)

Desktop

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. On NVidia Shield using FranceTV app (French TV named FranceTV - website francetv.fr) videos are stuck on loading with this url blocked **lma.npaw.com**.
My Nvidia Shield is using my local AdguardHome (version 0.107.61) as DNS server and I only use AdGuard DNS filter (default filter) as blocklist.
If I add this domain in allowed domain, the video loads correctly.

Screenshot seems irrelevant in this case because the screen stays black with a rolling circle in the middle of the screen.

comment.body:
@Yuki2718 Sorry, I think these rules are not compatible with MV3 and Safari

```adblock
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/\/?(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/\/?(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,third-party,redirect=noopjs
```

Do you know which rules could be used for those platforms?

comment.body:
> Not possible for MV3 due to rediculous memory limit, see [w3c/webextensions#344 (comment)](https://github.com/w3c/webextensions/issues/344#issuecomment-2775313455) But should be possible for Safari. BTW I've been observing them for years and now they only use `.com`, so `(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)` can be simplified to `com`.

I think for MV3, adding per-domain would be still OK. I see there are some `denyallow` rules for other ads types but not this one I think. If there are none for this type yet, I think we can have 2 ways:

- Using the beginning part like at https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/07d2212a78de1ef00abca687e4d177367a0ff720/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L20169:

```adblock
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\//$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party,redirect=noopjs,domain=tokyomotion.net
```

- Using the ending part:

```adblock
/\/[a-f0-9]{32}\.js(?:$|\?)/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party,redirect=noopjs,domain=tokyomotion.net
```

---

> Does ... work for Safari?

Thanks. I'll test this rule.

comment.body:
Then I assume the problme is in `[^&=?\s]`. It can be negation `^` or use of `\s`, but likely to be the latter. Please test
```
/^https:\/\/[a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z][a-z]+\.com\/en\/([a-z][a-z]+\/)?([a-z][a-z]+\/)?[a-z][a-z]+\?([a-z]+=[^&=? ]*?&)*?id=[12][0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]/$script,third-party,match-case
```

comment.body:
> Do you know which rules could be used for those platforms?

Not possible for MV3 due to rediculous memory limit, see https://github.com/w3c/webextensions/issues/344#issuecomment-2775313455 But should be possible for Safari. BTW I've been observing them for years and now they only use `.com`, so `(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)` can be simplified to `com`.

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Hi. These domains are used also for tracking on sites, and blocked in many popular lists.
You may try our private DNS - it is possible to block/unblock any domain here (add to user rules `@@||convertbox.com^`).

pull_request.title: Bump markdownlint-cli from 0.44.0 to 0.45.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [markdownlint-cli](https://github.com/igorshubovych/markdownlint-cli) from 0.44.0 to 0.45.0.
Release notes

Sourced from markdownlint-cli's releases.

v0.45.0

  • Update markdownlint dependency to 0.38.0
    • Add MD059/descriptive-link-text
    • Improve MD025/MD027/MD036/MD038/MD041/MD043/MD045/MD051/MD052
    • Remove support for end-of-life Node version 18
  • Update all dependencies via Dependabot
Commits
  • 192ad82 Bump version 0.45.0
  • f6225d2 Bump nano-spawn from 0.2.0 to 1.0.1
  • 1b8554a Add released Node version 24 to CI workflow.
  • 836379f Remove optional constant fs.R_OK
  • 1a19ddb Bump minimatch from 9.0.5 to 10.0.1
  • 5033e1e Pass newly-required markdownItFactory option to markdownlint.
  • b7e47f8 Bump markdownlint from 0.37.4 to 0.38.0
  • c3fa9f5 Bump glob from 10.4.5 to 11.0.2
  • b983f61 Remove support for end-of-life Node.js version 18.
  • 8878ef0 Bump ignore from 7.0.3 to 7.0.4
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=markdownlint-cli&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=0.44.0&new-version=0.45.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: pornhub.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [NSFW] [http://pornhub.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fpornhub.com) ### Comment > AdGuard DNS Parental Control works as expected over **Wi-Fi**, but fails to filter any content on **cellular data**. > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Install the **AdGuard iOS app** and activate the custom DNS server, or install the **AdGuard DNS profile** on iOS. > 2. Connect to Wi-Fi and verify that blocking and safe search are working. > 3. Switch to **cellular data** and test again — content is not filtered. > *(Other AdGuard DNS rules and features still work regularly.)* > > ## Expected Behavior > Parental control features — **site blocking**, **safe search**, **YouTube restricted mode**, and **hidden comments** — should function over both **Wi-Fi and cellular**. > > ## Actual Behavior > On cellular, **adult content is not blocked** and **safe search is disabled**. > > ## Environment > - Device: *iPhone (iOS 17+)* > - DNS Profile: *Personal Private AdGuard DNS* > > ## Notes > - Tested across multiple devices: *Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Apple TV* > - Tried various server configurations, including default with only **Parental Control** enabled > - Parental Control fails on **cellular data**, including for devices connected via **hotspot** > - [AdGuard DNS test](https://adguard.com/en/test.html) passes on cellular > - Tested with both **native iOS DNS** and **AdGuard DNS app** implementation > - The screenshot showing AdGuard DNS disabled was taken while connected to **Wi-Fi** > - The screenshot showing AdGuard DNS enabled was taken while using **cellular data** ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ht2mlc9zw0840ko84cok8ogw4gs00s05znlb30c9nw.png?nc=1) [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2wdou2dkixa8k8c8w4kkc0okg8koc0g2d28y8pko2z.jpg?nc=1) [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/qbhrhb853hck0oc0k4g0k0w484g84ckhao7bgs7dfk.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS DNS setup: | iPhone 12 Pro running AdGuard DNS Parental Control DNS server: | Private AdGuard DNS server System version: | iOS 18.5 Browser: | Safari Blocklists: | General:

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
